feeds.content:

feeds.content:
Nigeria’s President, Muhammadu Buhari, is set to honour all athletes that won different medals for the nation in various international sporting tournaments in 2015.

The Minister of Youth and Sports, Solomon Dalung, confirmed that the President would host the athletes at the Presidential Villa in Abuja on Thursday, January 21.

Among those yet to be rewarded are the Golden Eaglet

feeds.description: …Says he will Continue to Champion Equity among Religions By Waheed Adekunle, Osogbo Governor of the State of Osun, Ogbeni Rauf Aregbesola has cleared the air on the lingering rumours making the round that his government was proposing a new tax regime on the religious institutions across the state in order to alternate the adverse..." The post We are not Imposing Taxes on Religious Institutions – Aregbesola appeared first on OsunDefender.
feeds.title: We are not Imposing Taxes on Religious Institutions – Aregbesola
feeds.content:
…Says he will Continue to Champion Equity among Religions

By Waheed Adekunle, Osogbo

Governor of the State of Osun, Ogbeni Rauf Aregbesola has cleared the air on the lingering rumours making the round that his government was proposing a new tax regime on the religious institutions across the state in order to alternate the adverse effects of the dwindling revenues from the Federal Accounts.

Governor Aregbesola who reacted spontaneously on what he described as sponsored venomous antics of the opposition and enemies of his administration, said on no account does he has the intention to neither propose nor impose tax payment on mosques, churches and traditional temples.

Aregbesola made the statement while addressing the muslim faithful during a Jumat service, at Islahudeen Central Mosque, Osogbo.

Governor Aregbesola who frowned at the development said though his government has been looking for ever

feeds.description: Mexico has officially started the process of extraditing drug kingpin, Joaquin “El Chapo” Guzman, to the United States (US). The authorities said Interpol officers served him papers at the Altiplano prison, near Mexico City. 58-year-old Guzman, escaped from the maximum security jail in July and was recaptured on Friday. According to BBC, Mexico is also […] The post Mexico Begins El Chapo’s Extradition To US appeared first on Channels Television.
feeds.title: Mexico Begins El Chapo’s Extradition To US
feeds.content:
Mexico has officially started the process of extraditing drug kingpin, Joaquin “El Chapo” Guzman, to the United States (US).

The authorities said Interpol officers served him papers at the Altiplano prison, near Mexico City.

58-year-old Guzman, escaped from the maximum security jail in July and was recaptured on Friday.

According to BBC, Mexico is also considering investigating Hollywood actor, Sean Penn, who interviewed Guzman soon after his jail break.

Undisclosed Mexican officials said Penn’s secret
feeds.categories: Mexico City,Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzman,Mexico,World News,drug kingpin,Hollywood actor,Sean Penn,Altiplano prison

feeds.description: The Vice President of Nigeria, Professor Yemi Osinbajo, has commended the military for ensuring that the Boko Haram insurgents no longer hold any territory in Nigeria. The Vice President spoke at a special church service on Sunday to mark the 2016 Armed Forces Remembrance Day in Abuja. He said that the Federal Government was confident that […] The post Osinbajo Praises Military For Curbing Insurgency appeared first on Channels Television.
feeds.title: Osinbajo Praises Military For Curbing Insurgency
feeds.content:
The Vice President of Nigeria, Professor Yemi Osinbajo, has commended the military for ensuring that the Boko Haram insurgents no longer hold any territory in Nigeria.

The Vice President spoke at a special church service on Sunday to mark the 2016 Armed Forces Remembrance Day in Abuja.

He said that the Federal Government was confident that the military would not only win the war against the insurgents but would also continue to ensure the protection of Nigeria’s territorial integrity.

Professor Osinbajo ex
